snippet: The careless remarks of an economist about the Affordable Care Act were an insult to Americans and were largely wrong.
abstract: Editorial criticizes comments, both offensive and largely wrong, by health care reform advocate Jonathan Gruber; notes he stated in recently-surfaced video that the Affordable Care Act relied on a lack of transparency and the stupidity of the American voter to pass; argues comments can only harm the cause of reform, and should not be taken as evidence that the law was hatched in secrecy and foisted on the public by trickery.
lead_paragraph: The careless remarks of an economist about the Affordable Care Act were an insult to Americans and were largely wrong.
